description: Test your knowledge of destinations, travel tips, and world cultures

questions.question: Which city is known as the 'City of Light'?
questions.funFact: Paris got this nickname not just for its early adoption of street lighting, but also for its role in the Age of Enlightenment!
questions.story: Paris earned its nickname 'La Ville Lumi√®re' (The City of Light) in the 1860s when it became one of the first European cities to adopt gas street lighting. The nickname also reflects Paris's role as a center of education, ideas, and enlightenment during the Age of Reason.

questions.question: What is the world's longest commercial flight route?
questions.funFact: The flight covers 9,537 miles and takes around 18 hours and 50 minutes!
questions.story: Singapore Airlines operates the world's longest commercial flight between Singapore and New York. The route uses an Airbus A350-900ULR (Ultra Long Range) specially designed for such distances. The aircraft carries extra fuel and fewer passengers to make the journey possible.

questions.question: Which famous trail follows the ancient Inca path to Machu Picchu?
questions.funFact: The Inca Trail includes over 50,000 stone steps!
questions.story: The Inca Trail was part of a vast network of roads built by the Inca Empire to connect their territories. The classic four-day trek to Machu Picchu follows ancient stone paths, passes through cloud forests, and includes visits to several other Inca ruins before reaching the famous 'lost city'.
